frameDefinitions: An Entity is evaluated for whether or not it belongs to a particular Reference_category in a context where its category membership is doubtful.
An Employee has a Position doing work in a particular Field, or doing work on a particular Task, for which an Employer gives Compensation to the Employee.
This frame concerns transparent nouns that denote Instances of Types of entities or events.
An Agent has a choice of whether or not to participate in some Desirable_event because of an Opportunity, a situation not completely under the Agent's control and usually of a limited duration.
This scenario describes a series of Events, associated with a single Participant, i.e., the history of the Participant.
There exist a number of different possible Situations that may happen in the future.
frameExamples:
It can be hard to get your money back after discovering you've bought a <t>bogus</t>
autograph for hundreds or thousands of dollars!
Undocumented foreigners are <t>working</t> as  building contractors for Laing Builders.

The survey confirmed that management interference in team operations had increased , and <t><fex name='Instance'>instances</fex></t> of management decisions being taken without team consultation had also increased .
It would be pleasant in the <t>opportune</t> absence of the clergyman to have a dance . DNI
We've been worried about our recent hire's <t><fex name='Events'>history</fex></t> of deceiving employers.
You have but two <t><fex name='Situation'>choices</fex></t> for your daughter .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Entity</fen> that is being evaluated in terms of whether it is an instance of the <fen>Reference_category</fen>.
The type relative to which the <fen>Entity</fen> is evaluated.
The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform a <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
The <fen>Employer</fen> gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place_of_employment</fen> of the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The label given to a particular type of employment.
The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform the <fen>Task</fen> to recieve <fen>Compensation</fen> from the <fen>Employer</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Field</fen> in which one works.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> period during which an <fen>Employee</fen>  works for an <fen>Employer</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Employee</fen> works.
A thing or episode of a certain <fen>Type</fen>.
The category of thing or event of which an <fen>Instance</fen> is picked out.
The situation during which the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen> is possible. For nominal LUs, this is generally in the second layer and contains the target.
The sentient agent that may or may not participate in the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen>.
A situation or event that the <fen>Agent</fen> can participating in during the period of the <fen>Opportunity</fen>.

The <fen>Participant</fen> is either an active participant in all of the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Agent or Patient), or is more peripherally associated with the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Location or Topic).
The <fen>Events</fen> which the <fen>Participant</fen> is a part of. This role is used to mark the frame-evoking element.
When the <fen>Events</fen> concerning the <fen>Participant</fen> occured.
Something that may happen in the future, or at least whose factual status is unresolved. This is often tagged in a second role layer and generally contains the target.

An individual involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.

'<fex name='Agent'>You</fex> have a <t>choice</t>.'
An entity intimately involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The bomb found at the US Embassy in Berlin</fex> was fake.
<fex>My Mom</fex> works for the Michigan Department of Agriculture.
My mom works <fex>for an Eye Doctor</fex>.
The undocumented foreigners were working <fex>at the organic farm</fex>.
Undocumented foreigners work <fex>in construction</fex> for years.

<fex>From 2000-2001</fex>, Mr. Eckhardt clerked for The Honorable Jerry A. Funk,
United States Bankruptcy Judge, Middle District of Florida.
I collected two <t>specimens</t> <fex>of this rare species</fex>.
We've been worried about <fex>our recent hire's</fex> history of deceiving employers.
We will focus on events in her recent <fex>history</fex>.
You have one choice to make <fex>for him</fex>.
